cards.question: CTRL+A CTRL+E
cards.answer: Go to the start/end of the command line

cards.question: CTRL+U CTRL+K
cards.answer: Delete from cursor to the start/end of the command line

cards.question: CTRL+W OPTION+D
cards.answer: Delete from cursor to start/end of word (whole word if at the boundary)

cards.question: CTRL+Y
cards.answer: Paste word or text that was cut using one of the deletion shortcuts (such as the one above) after the cursor

cards.question: CTRL+XX
cards.answer: Move between start of command line and current cursor position (and back again)

cards.question: OPTION+B OPTION+F
cards.answer: Move backward/forward one word (or go to start of word the cursor is currently on)

cards.question: OPTION+C
cards.answer: Capitalize to end of word starting at cursor (whole word if cursor is at the beginning of word)

cards.question: OPTION+U
cards.answer: Make uppercase from cursor to end of word

cards.question: OPTION+L
cards.answer: Make lowercase from cursor to end of word

cards.question: OPTION+T
cards.answer: Swap current word with previous

cards.question: CTRL+F CTRL+B
cards.answer: Move forward/backward one character

cards.question: CTRL+D CTRL+H
cards.answer: Delete character after/before under cursor

cards.question: CTRL+T
cards.answer: Swap character under cursor with the previous one

cards.question: CTRL+R
cards.answer: Search the history backwards

cards.question: CTRL+J
cards.answer: End the search at current history entry

cards.question: CTRL+G
cards.answer: Escape from history searching mode

cards.question: CTRL+P
cards.answer: Previous command in history (i.e., walk back through the command history)

cards.question: CTRL+N
cards.answer: Next command in history (i.e., walk forward through the command history)

cards.question: CTRL+_
cards.answer: Undo last command

cards.question: OPTION+.
cards.answer: Use the last word of the previous command

cards.question: CTRL+L
cards.answer: Clear the screen

cards.question: CTRL+S
cards.answer: Stops the output to the screen (for long running verbose command)

cards.question: CTRL+Q
cards.answer: Allow output to the screen (if previously stopped using command above)

cards.question: CTRL+C
cards.answer: Terminate the command

cards.question: CTRL+Z
cards.answer: Suspend/stop the command
Run last command

cards.question: !blah
cards.answer: Run the most recent command that starts with blah

cards.question: !blah:p
cards.answer: Print out the command that !blah would run (also adds it as the latest command in the command history
The last word of the previous command (same as OPTION+.)

cards.question: !$:p
cards.answer: Print out the word that !$ would substitute
The previous command except for the first word (e.g., if you type find some_file.txt /, then !* would give you some_file.txt /)

cards.question: !*:p
cards.answer: Print out what !* would substitute
